Profile 8.Description: APT12 is believed to be a cyber espionage group linked to the Chinese People's Liberation Army, targeting sectors consistent with PRC goals

Profile 11.Description: APT4 appears to target the defense industrial base at a higher rate than other commercial organizations

Profile 12.Industries: IT service providers, healthcare, aerospace, government organizations
Profile 12.Description: APT10 is a China-linked APT group known for cyberespionage and economic gain. It targets various industries including IT service providers, healthcare, aerospace, and government organizations. The group uses supply chain attacks, spear-phishing emails, Remote Access Trojans (RATs), credential theft, and lateral movement.

Profile 13.Description: APT36 is a Pakistan-linked APT group motivated by cyberespionage. It targets the Indian government and defense sector using spear-phishing emails with malicious attachments, Crimson RAT malware, and mobile malware targeting Android devices.

Profile 14.Description: StrongPity is a Turkey-linked APT group motivated by cyberespionage. It targets dissidents, Kurdish groups, and government agencies using watering hole attacks, trojanized installers, keyloggers, and spyware.

Profile 15.Description: The Syrian Electronic Army is a Syria-linked APT group motivated by political influence and hacktivism. It targets media and political opponents using website defacements, phishing attacks, and social engineering.

Profile 18.Description: APT12 is a China-linked APT group believed to be associated with the Chinese People’s Liberation Army. It targets journalists, government, and defense industrial base sectors. The group uses phishing emails with malicious attachments or links.

Profile 19.Industries: healthcare, pharmaceuticals, construction, engineering, aerospace, defense
Profile 19.Description: APT9 is a China-linked APT group that engages in cyber operations for data theft, focusing on competitive data and projects. It targets organizations in healthcare, pharmaceuticals, construction, engineering, aerospace, and defense.

Profile 20.Description: APT8 is a China-linked APT group that engages in cyber operations for intellectual property theft. It targets organizations in multiple countries including the US, Germany, the UK, India, and Japan. The group uses spear-phishing emails with malicious attachments or links and exploits vulnerable internet-facing web servers.

Profile 21.Industries: construction, engineering, aerospace, defense industrial base
Profile 21.Description: APT7 is a China-linked APT group that targets the construction, engineering, aerospace, and defense industrial base sectors.

Profile 22.alias: APT4, Maverick Panda, Sykipot Group, Wisp
Profile 22.Industries: aerospace, defense, industrial engineering, electronics, automotive, government, telecommunications, transportation
Profile 22.Description: APT4 is a China-linked APT group that targets a wide range of industries including aerospace, defense, industrial engineering, electronics, automotive, government, telecommunications, and transportation. The group uses spear-phishing messages with themes related to the US government, Department of Defense, or defense industrial base.

Profile 23.Industries: aerospace, defense, construction, engineering, high tech, telecommunications, transportation
Profile 23.Description: APT3 is a China-linked APT group that targets various industries including aerospace, defense, construction, engineering, high tech, telecommunications, and transportation.

Profile 25.Description: No information is available from the provided URL. Please revise the input with relevant sources.

Profile 26.Description: APT12 is believed to be a cyber espionage group thought to have links to the Chinese People's Liberation Army. APT12's targets are consistent with larger People's Republic of China (PRC) goals. Intrusions and campaigns conducted by this group are in-line with PRC goals and self-interest in Taiwan.

Profile 28.Description: APT8 engages in cyber operations where the goal is intellectual property theft, usually focusing on the data and projects that make an organization competitive within its field. We assess that this is a freelancer group located in China with some nation-state sponsorship.

Profile 30.Description: APT4 appears to target the defense industrial base (DIB) at a higher rate of frequency than other commercial organizations. However, APT4's history of targeted intrusions is wide in scope.

Profile 31.Industries: aerospace and defense,construction and engineering,high tech,telecommunications,transportation

Profile 32.Description: APT9 engages in cyber operations where the goal is data theft, usually focusing on the data and projects that make a particular organization competitive within its field.

Profile 33.Description: APT25 engages in cyber operations where the goal is data theft.

Profile 35.Description: APT12 is believed to be a cyber espionage group thought to have links to the Chinese People’s Liberation Army. APT12's targets are consistent with larger People’s Republic of China (PRC) goals. Intrusions and campaigns conducted by this group are in-line with PRC goals and self-interest in Taiwan.

Profile 36.Industries: construction and engineering, aerospace, telecom firms, governments
Profile 36.Description: APT10 is a Chinese cyber espionage group that Mandiant has tracked since 2009. They have historically targeted construction and engineering, aerospace, and telecom firms, and governments in the United States, Europe, and Japan. We believe that the targeting of these industries has been in support of Chinese national security goals, including acquiring valuable military and intelligence information as well as the theft of confidential business data to support Chinese corporations.
